HAD ENOUGH OF RAKSHIT, GAEKWAD AND ALL OTHER THEORY BOOKS THINK YOU KNOW 
 
EVERYTHING TO BRING TO LIFE ANY ELECRONIC CIRCUIT 
 
IF YES, THEN CONTRIVE 2K14 IS THE PLACE TO BE 
 
All you need to do is finish of a basic MCQ PAPER, devise the simple circuit needed to be made in the 
 
quickest time, pass a few interview rounds..and you're the winner. SOUNDS EASY 
 
Lets see it then!! Come to CONTRIVE, THE ANNUAL CIRCUIT DESIGN COMPETITION, AND 
 
TEST YOURSELF OUT, COZ ITS GONNA BE BIGGER BETTER, AND TRICKIER THIS YEAR! 
 
Refer to the RULES section for complete set of rules and instruction. 
 
Rules and Regulations: 
 
 The complete event is an on spot event and all the rounds would be held at Netaji 
 
Subhash Engineering College, Kolkata during Avenir 2014. 
 
 Contrive is restricted to students currently pursuing their education in any 
 
recognized educational institute. 
 
 A maximum of 3 participants can combine to form a team. 
 
 Students from different colleges can be a part of the same team. 
 
 The competition will be held in three stages 
 
Rounds : 
 
Round 1 ~ 
 
This round will consist of 30-40 multiple choice questions related to basic electrical and 
 
electronics. Each team will have to solve these questions in the given time. 
 
Round 2 ~ 
 
 In this round each team will be given a task of making a circuit related to Analog and 
 
Digital Electronics. 
 
 Each team will be given a multi-meter and a regulated DC power supply. 
 
 Team will have to make the circuit out of the GIVEN components only. 
 
 Before connecting the power supply, the circuit must be checked and approved by the 
 
judges. 
 
THIS ROUND TOO IS CLOCKED 
 
Round 3 ~ 
 
THE FINAL ROUND... 
 
This is the Group Interview Round in which each team will be questioned by the judges on the basis 
 
of the circuit made by the respective group. 
 
Judging Parameters : 
 
The winner will be selected on the basis of the score secured by the respective groups in Rounds 2 
 
and 3 jointly. 
 
In all the cases the decision taken by the judges will be final.
